verses.text: The sons of Israel ate the manna forty years, until they came to an inhabited land; they ate the manna until they came to the border of the land of Canaan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now an omer is a tenth of an ephah.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the congregation of the sons of Israel journeyed by stages from the wilderness of Sin, according to the command of the Lord, and camped at Rephidim, and there was no water for the people to drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore the people quarreled with Moses and said, “Give us water that we may drink.” And Moses said to them, “Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you test the Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people thirsted there for water; and they grumbled against Moses and said, “Why, now, have you brought us up from Egypt, to kill us and our children and our livestock with thirst?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses cried out to the Lord, saying, “What shall I do to this people? A little more and they will stone me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Pass before the people and take with you some of the elders of Israel; and take in your hand your staff with which you struck the Nile, and go.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock at Horeb; and you shall strike the rock, and water will come out of it, that the people may drink.” And Moses did so in the sight of the elders of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He named the place Massah and Meribah because of the quarrel of the sons of Israel, and because they tested the Lord, saying, “Is the Lord among us, or not?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Amalek came and fought against Israel at Rephidim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses said to Joshua, “Choose men for us and go out, fight against Amalek. Tomorrow I will station myself on the top of the hill with the staff of God in my hand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Joshua did as Moses told him, and fought against Amalek; and Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came about when Moses held his hand up, that Israel prevailed, and when he let his hand down, Amalek prevailed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Moses’ hands were heavy. Then they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it; and Aaron and Hur supported his hands, one on one side and one on the other. Thus his hands were steady until the sun set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Joshua overwhelmed Amalek and his people with the edge of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Write this in a book as a memorial and recite it to Joshua, that I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses built an altar and named it The Lord is My Banner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, “The Lord has sworn; the Lord will have war against Amalek from generation to generation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard of all that God had done for Moses and for Israel His people, how the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Moses’ wife Zipporah, after he had sent her away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her two sons, of whom one was named Gershom, for Moses said, “I have been a sojourner in a foreign land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other was named Eliezer, for he said, “The God of my father was my help, and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses in the wilderness where he was camped, at the mount of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and her two sons with her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and he bowed down and kissed him; and they asked each other of their welfare and went into the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardship that had befallen them on the journey, and how the Lord had delivered them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jethro rejoiced over all the goodness which the Lord had done to Israel, in delivering them from the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jethro said, “Blessed be the Lord who delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians and from the hand of Pharaoh, and who delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I know that the Lord is greater than all the gods; indeed, it was proven when they dealt proudly against the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God, and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat a meal with Moses’ father-in-law before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It came about the next day that Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood about Moses from the morning until the evening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people, he said, “What is this thing that you are doing for the people? Why do you alone sit as judge and all the people stand about you from morning until evening?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have a dispute, it comes to me, and I judge between a man and his neighbor and make known the statutes of God and His laws.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “The thing that you are doing is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will surely wear out, both yourself and these people who are with you, for the task is too heavy for you; you cannot do it alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now listen to me: I will give you counsel, and God be with you. You be the people’s representative before God, and you bring the disputes to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then teach them the statutes and the laws, and make known to them the way in which they are to walk and the work they are to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, you shall select out of all the people able men who fear God, men of truth, those who hate dishonest gain; and you shall place these over them as leaders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties and of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them judge the people at all times; and let it be that every major dispute they will bring to you, but every minor dispute they themselves will judge. So it will be easier for you, and they will bear the burden with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you do this thing and God so commands you, then you will be able to endure, and all these people also will go to their place in peace.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses listened to his father-in-law and did all that he had said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses chose able men out of all Israel and made them heads over the people, leaders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties and of tens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They judged the people at all times; the difficult dispute they would bring to Moses, but every minor dispute they themselves would judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses bade his father-in-law farewell, and he went his way into his own land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the third month after the sons of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on that very day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they set out from Rephidim, they came to the wilderness of Sinai and camped in the wilderness; and there Israel camped in front of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses went up to God, and the Lord called to him from the mountain, saying, “Thus you shall say to the house of Jacob and tell the sons of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘You yourselves have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles’ wings, and brought you to Myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then, if you will indeed obey My voice and keep My covenant, then you shall be My own possession among all the peoples, for all the earth is Mine;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you shall speak to the sons of Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses came and called the elders of the people, and set before them all these words which the Lord had commanded him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people answered together and said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do!” And Moses brought back the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “Behold, I will come to you in a thick cloud, so that the people may hear when I speak with you and may also believe in you forever.” Then Moses told the words of the people to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also said to Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their garments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and let them be ready for the third day, for on the third day the Lord will come down on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set bounds for the people all around, saying, ‘Beware that you do not go up on the mountain or touch the border of it; whoever touches the mountain shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot through; whether beast or man, he shall not live.’ When the ram’s horn sounds a long blast, they shall come up to the mountain.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and consecrated the people, and they washed their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to the people, “Be ready for the third day; do not go near a woman.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it came about on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunder and lightning flashes and a thick cloud upon the mountain and a very loud trumpet sound, so that all the people who were in the camp trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Mount Sinai was all in smoke because the Lord descended upon it in fire; and its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked violently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke and God answered him with thunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord came down on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain; and the Lord called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Go down, warn the people, so that they do not break through to the Lord to gaze, and many of them perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also let the priests who come near to the Lord consecrate themselves, or else the Lord will break out against them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the Lord, “The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You warned us, saying, ‘Set bounds about the mountain and consecrate it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to him, “Go down and come up again, you and Aaron with you; but do not let the priests and the people break through to come up to the Lord, or He will break forth upon them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses went down to the people and told them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then God spoke all these words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall have no other gods before Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not make for yourself an idol, or any likeness of what is in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the water under the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not worship them or serve them; for I, the Lord your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, on the third and the fourth generations of those who hate Me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but showing lovingkindness to thousands, to those who love Me and keep My commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain, for the Lord will not leave him unpunished who takes His name in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but the seventh day is a sabbath of the Lord your God; in it you shall not do any work, you or your son or your daughter, your male or your female servant or your cattle or your sojourner who stays with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in six days the Lord made the heavens and the earth, the sea and all that is in them, and rested on the seventh day; therefore the Lord blessed the sabbath day and made it holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be prolonged in the land which the Lord your God gives you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not murder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not commit adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not steal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not covet your neighbor’s house; you shall not covet your neighbor’s wife or his male servant or his female servant or his ox or his donkey or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the people perceived the thunder and the lightning flashes and the sound of the trumpet and the mountain smoking; and when the people saw it, they trembled and stood at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to Moses, “Speak to us yourself and we will listen; but let not God speak to us, or we will die.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses said to the people, “Do not be afraid; for God has come in order to test you, and in order that the fear of Him may remain with you, so that you may not sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people stood at a distance, while Moses approached the thick cloud where God was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Thus you shall say to the sons of Israel, ‘You yourselves have seen that I have spoken to you from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not make other gods besides Me; gods of silver or gods of gold, you shall not make for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make an altar of earth for Me, and you shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your oxen; in every place where I cause My name to be remembered, I will come to you and bless you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you make an altar of stone for Me, you shall not build it of cut stones, for if you wield your tool on it, you will profane it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall not go up by steps to My altar, so that your nakedness will not be exposed on it.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now these are the ordinances which you are to set before them:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you buy a Hebrew slave, he shall serve for six years; but on the seventh he shall go out as a free man without payment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he comes alone, he shall go out alone; if he is the husband of a wife, then his wife shall go out with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If his master gives him a wife, and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall belong to her master, and he shall go out alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the slave plainly says, ‘I love my master, my wife and my children; I will not go out as a free man,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then his master shall bring him to God, then he shall bring him to the door or the doorpost. And his master shall pierce his ear with an awl; and he shall serve him permanently.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man sells his daughter as a female slave, she is not to go free as the male slaves do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If she is displeasing in the eyes of her master who designated her for himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He does not have authority to sell her to a foreign people because of his unfairness to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he designates her for his son, he shall deal with her according to the custom of daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he takes to himself another woman, he may not reduce her food, her clothing, or her conjugal rights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If he will not do these three things for her, then she shall go out for nothing, without payment of money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who strikes a man so that he dies shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if he did not lie in wait for him, but God let him fall into his hand, then I will appoint you a place to which he may flee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, however, a man acts presumptuously toward his neighbor, so as to kill him craftily, you are to take him even from My altar, that he may die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who strikes his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who kidnaps a man, whether he sells him or he is found in his possession, shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If men have a quarrel and one strikes the other with a stone or with his fist, and he does not die but remains in bed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if he gets up and walks around outside on his staff, then he who struck him shall go unpunished; he shall only pay for his loss of time, and shall take care of him until he is completely healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man strikes his male or female slave with a rod and he dies at his hand, he shall be punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, however, he survives a day or two, no vengeance shall be taken; for he is his property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If men struggle with each other and strike a woman with child so that she gives birth prematurely, yet there is no injury, he shall surely be fined as the woman’s husband may demand of him, and he shall pay as the judges decide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if there is any further injury, then you shall appoint as a penalty life for life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: burn for burn, wound for wound, bruise for bruise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man strikes the eye of his male or female slave, and destroys it, he shall let him go free on account of his eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if he knocks out a tooth of his male or female slave, he shall let him go free on account of his tooth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If an ox gores a man or a woman to death, the ox shall surely be stoned and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the ox shall go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If, however, an ox was previously in the habit of goring and its owner has been warned, yet he does not confine it and it kills a man or a woman, the ox shall be stoned and its owner also shall be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If a ransom is demanded of him, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatever is demanded of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whether it gores a son or a daughter, it shall be done to him according to the same rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the ox gores a male or female slave, the owner shall give his or her master thirty shekels of silver, and the ox shall be stoned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man opens a pit, or digs a pit and does not cover it over, and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the owner of the pit shall make restitution; he shall give money to its owner, and the dead animal shall become his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If one man’s ox hurts another’s so that it dies, then they shall sell the live ox and divide its price equally; and also they shall divide the dead ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Or if it is known that the ox was previously in the habit of goring, yet its owner has not confined it, he shall surely pay ox for ox, and the dead animal shall become his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man steals an ox or a sheep and slaughters it or sells it, he shall pay five oxen for the ox and four sheep for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the thief is caught while breaking in and is struck so that he dies, there will be no bloodguiltiness on his account.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the sun has risen on him, there will be bloodguiltiness on his account. He shall surely make restitution; if he owns nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If what he stole is actually found alive in his possession, whether an ox or a donkey or a sheep, he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man lets a field or vineyard be grazed bare and lets his animal loose so that it grazes in another man’s field, he shall make restitution from the best of his own field and the best of his own vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a fire breaks out and spreads to thorn bushes, so that stacked grain or the standing grain or the field itself is consumed, he who started the fire shall surely make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man gives his neighbor money or goods to keep for him and it is stolen from the man’s house, if the thief is caught, he shall pay double.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If the thief is not caught, then the owner of the house shall appear before the judges, to determine whether he laid his hands on his neighbor’s property.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For every breach of trust, whether it is for ox, for donkey, for sheep, for clothing, or for any lost thing about which one says, ‘This is it,’ the case of both parties shall come before the judges; he whom the judges condemn shall pay double to his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man gives his neighbor a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any animal to keep for him, and it dies or is hurt or is driven away while no one is looking,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: an oath before the Lord shall be made by the two of them that he has not laid hands on his neighbor’s property; and its owner shall accept it, and he shall not make restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if it is actually stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If it is all torn to pieces, let him bring it as evidence; he shall not make restitution for what has been torn to pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man borrows anything from his neighbor, and it is injured or dies while its owner is not with it, he shall make full restitution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If its owner is with it, he shall not make restitution; if it is hired, it came for its hire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If a man seduces a virgin who is not engaged, and lies with her, he must pay a dowry for her to be his wife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money equal to the dowry for virgins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not allow a sorceress to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Whoever lies with an animal shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “He who sacrifices to any god, other than to the Lord alone, shall be utterly destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not wrong a stranger or oppress him, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not afflict any widow or orphan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you afflict him at all, and if he does cry out to Me, I will surely hear his cry;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and My anger will be kindled, and I will kill you with the sword, and your wives shall become widows and your children fatherless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you lend money to My people, to the poor among you, you are not to act as a creditor to him; you shall not charge him interest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ever take your neighbor’s cloak as a pledge, you are to return it to him before the sun sets,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for that is his only covering; it is his cloak for his body. What else shall he sleep in? And it shall come about that when he cries out to Me, I will hear him, for I am gracious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not curse God, nor curse a ruler of your people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not delay the offering from your harvest and your vintage. The firstborn of your sons you shall give to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall do the same with your oxen and with your sheep. It shall be with its mother seven days; on the eighth day you shall give it to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall be holy men to Me, therefore you shall not eat any flesh torn to pieces in the field; you shall throw it to the dogs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not bear a false report; do not join your hand with a wicked man to be a malicious witness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not follow the masses in doing evil, nor shall you testify in a dispute so as to turn aside after a multitude in order to pervert justice;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor shall you be partial to a poor man in his dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you meet your enemy’s ox or his donkey wandering away, you shall surely return it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you see the donkey of one who hates you lying helpless under its load, you shall refrain from leaving it to him, you shall surely release it with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not pervert the justice due to your needy brother in his dispute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep far from a false charge, and do not kill the innocent or the righteous, for I will not acquit the guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not take a bribe, for a bribe blinds the clear-sighted and subverts the cause of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not oppress a stranger, since you yourselves know the feelings of a stranger, for you also were strangers in the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall sow your land for six years and gather in its yield,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but on the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, so that the needy of your people may eat; and whatever they leave the beast of the field may eat. You are to do the same with your vineyard and your olive grove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Six days you are to do your work, but on the seventh day you shall cease from labor so that your ox and your donkey may rest, and the son of your female slave, as well as your stranger, may refresh themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now concerning everything which I have said to you, be on your guard; and do not mention the name of other gods, nor let them be heard from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Three times a year you shall celebrate a feast to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall observe the Feast of Unleavened Bread; for seven days you are to eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the appointed time in the month Abib, for in it you came out of Egypt. And none shall appear before Me empty-handed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also you shall observe the Feast of the Harvest of the first fruits of your labors from what you sow in the field; also the Feast of the Ingathering at the end of the year when you gather in the fruit of your labors from the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread; nor is the fat of My feast to remain overnight until morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall bring the choice first fruits of your soil into the house of the Lord your God.
“You are not to boil a young goat in the milk of its mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I am going to send an angel before you to guard you along the way and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be on your guard before him and obey his voice; do not be rebellious toward him, for he will not pardon your transgression, since My name is in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you truly obey his voice and do all that I say, then I will be an enemy to your enemies and an adversary to your adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For My angel will go before you and bring you in to the land of the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Canaanites, the Hivites and the Jebusites; and I will completely destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not worship their gods, nor serve them, nor do according to their deeds; but you shall utterly overthrow them and break their sacred pillars in pieces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you shall serve the Lord your God, and He will bless your bread and your water; and I will remove sickness from your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be no one miscarrying or barren in your land; I will fulfill the number of your days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send My terror ahead of you, and throw into confusion all the people among whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will send hornets ahead of you so that they will drive out the Hivites, the Canaanites, and the Hittites before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not drive them out before you in a single year, that the land may not become desolate and the beasts of the field become too numerous for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will drive them out before you little by little, until you become fruitful and take possession of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will fix your boundary from the Red Sea to the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to the River Euphrates; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you will drive them out before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make no covenant with them or with their gods.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall not live in your land, because they will make you sin against Me; for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then He said to Moses, “Come up to the Lord, you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu and seventy of the elders of Israel, and you shall worship at a distance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses alone, however, shall come near to the Lord, but they shall not come near, nor shall the people come up with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses came and recounted to the people all the words of the Lord and all the ordinances; and all the people answered with one voice and said, “All the words which the Lord has spoken we will do!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses wrote down all the words of the Lord. Then he arose early in the morning, and built an altar at the foot of the mountain with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He sent young men of the sons of Israel, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed young bulls as peace offerings to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and the other half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he took the book of the covenant and read it in the hearing of the people; and they said, “All that the Lord has spoken we will do, and we will be obedient!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses took the blood and sprinkled it on the people, and said, “Behold the blood of the covenant, which the Lord has made with you in accordance with all these words.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they saw the God of Israel; and under His feet there appeared to be a pavement of sapphire, as clear as the sky itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet He did not stretch out His hand against the nobles of the sons of Israel; and they saw God, and they ate and drank.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and remain there, and I will give you the stone tablets with the law and the commandment which I have written for their instruction.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Moses arose with Joshua his servant, and Moses went up to the mountain of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to the elders he said, “Wait here for us until we return to you. And behold, Aaron and Hur are with you; whoever has a legal matter, let him approach them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses went up to the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of the Lord rested on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days; and on the seventh day He called to Moses from the midst of the cloud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And to the eyes of the sons of Israel the appearance of the glory of the Lord was like a consuming fire on the mountain top.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses entered the midst of the cloud as he went up to the mountain; and Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell the sons of Israel to raise a contribution for Me; from every man whose heart moves him you shall raise My contribution.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the contribution which you are to raise from them: gold, silver and bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: blue, purple and scarlet material, fine linen, goat hair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: rams’ skins dyed red, porpoise skins, acacia wood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: oil for lighting, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: onyx stones and setting stones for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let them construct a sanctuary for Me, that I may dwell among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: According to all that I am going to show you, as the pattern of the tabernacle and the pattern of all its furniture, just so you shall construct it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall construct an ark of acacia wood two and a half cubits long, and one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, inside and out you shall overlay it, and you shall make a gold molding around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall cast four gold rings for it and fasten them on its four feet, and two rings shall be on one side of it and two rings on the other side of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to carry the ark with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark; they shall not be removed from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put into the ark the testimony which I shall give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two cherubim of gold, make them of hammered work at the two ends of the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make one cherub at one end and one cherub at the other end; you shall make the cherubim of one piece with the mercy seat at its two ends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cherubim shall have their wings spread upward, covering the mercy seat with their wings and facing one another; the faces of the cherubim are to be turned toward the mercy seat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat on top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony which I will give to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There I will meet with you; and from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim which are upon the ark of the testimony, I will speak to you about all that I will give you in commandment for the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a table of acacia wood, two cubits long and one cubit wide and one and a half cubits high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold and make a gold border around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for it a rim of a handbreadth around it; and you shall make a gold border for the rim around it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make four gold rings for it and put rings on the four corners which are on its four feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rings shall be close to the rim as holders for the poles to carry the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold, so that with them the table may be carried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its dishes and its pans and its jars and its bowls with which to pour drink offerings; you shall make them of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set the bread of the Presence on the table before Me at all times.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand and its base and its shaft are to be made of hammered work; its cups, its bulbs and its flowers shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six branches shall go out from its sides; three branches of the lampstand from its one side and three branches of the lampstand from its other side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three cups shall be shaped like almond blossoms in the one branch, a bulb and a flower, and three cups shaped like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bulb and a flower—so for six branches going out from the lampstand;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the lampstand four cups shaped like almond blossoms, its bulbs and its flowers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A bulb shall be under the first pair of branches coming out of it, and a bulb under the second pair of branches coming out of it, and a bulb under the third pair of branches coming out of it, for the six branches coming out of the lampstand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their bulbs and their branches shall be of one piece with it; all of it shall be one piece of hammered work of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall make its lamps seven in number; and they shall mount its lamps so as to shed light on the space in front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its snuffers and their trays shall be of pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be made from a talent of pure gold, with all these utensils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See that you make them after the pattern for them, which was shown to you on the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twisted linen and blue and purple and scarlet material; you shall make them with cherubim, the work of a skillful workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains shall have the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five curtains shall be joined to one another, and the other five curtains shall be joined to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make loops of blue on the edge of the outermost curtain in the first set, and likewise you shall make them on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty loops in the one curtain, and you shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is in the second set; the loops shall be opposite each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty clasps of gold, and join the curtains to one another with the clasps so that the tabernacle will be a unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall make curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; you shall make eleven curtains in all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the width of each curtain four cubits; the eleven curtains shall have the same measurements.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall join five curtains by themselves and the other six curtains by themselves, and you shall double over the sixth curtain at the front of the tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the first set, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that is outermost in the second set.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make fifty clasps of bronze, and you shall put the clasps into the loops and join the tent together so that it will be a unit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The overlapping part that is left over in the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that is left over, shall lap over the back of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The cubit on one side and the cubit on the other, of what is left over in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall lap over the sides of the tabernacle on one side and on the other, to cover it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make a covering for the tent of rams’ skins dyed red and a covering of porpoise skins above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall make the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ten cubits shall be the length of each board and one and a half cubits the width of each board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be two tenons for each board, fitted to one another; thus you shall do for all the boards of the tabernacle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards, two sockets under one board for its two tenons and two sockets under another board for its two tenons;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, twenty boards,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the rear of the tabernacle, to the west, you shall make six boards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two boards for the corners of the tabernacle at the rear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be double beneath, and together they shall be complete to its top to the first ring; thus it shall be with both of them: they shall form the two corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be eight boards with their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board and two sockets under another board.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall make bars of acacia wood, five for the boards of one side of the tabernacle,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle for the rear side to the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The middle bar in the center of the boards shall pass through from end to end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay the boards with gold and make their rings of gold as holders for the bars; and you shall overlay the bars with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall erect the tabernacle according to its plan which you have been shown in the mountain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a veil of blue and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen; it shall be made with cherubim, the work of a skillful workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, their hooks also being of gold, on four sockets of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall hang up the veil under the clasps, and shall bring in the ark of the testimony there within the veil; and the veil shall serve for you as a partition between the holy place and the holy of holies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony in the holy of holies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand opposite the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south; and you shall put the table on the north side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a screen for the doorway of the tent of blue and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen, the work of a weaver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make five pillars of acacia for the screen and overlay them with gold, their hooks also being of gold; and you shall cast five sockets of bronze for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar shall be square, and its height shall be three cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it, and you shall overlay it with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make its pails for removing its ashes, and its shovels and its basins and its forks and its firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for it a grating of network of bronze, and on the net you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put it beneath, under the ledge of the altar, so that the net will reach halfway up the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its poles shall be inserted into the rings, so that the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make it hollow with planks; as it was shown to you in the mountain, so they shall make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the court of the tabernacle. On the south side there shall be hangings for the court of fine twisted linen one hundred cubits long for one side;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and its pillars shall be twenty, with their twenty sockets of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, and its twenty pillars with their twenty sockets of bronze; the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the width of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits with their ten pillars and their ten sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The width of the court on the east side shall be fifty cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hangings for the one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits with their three pillars and their three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits with their three pillars and their three sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the gate of the court there shall be a screen of twenty cubits, of blue and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen, the work of a weaver, with their four pillars and their four sockets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the pillars around the court shall be furnished with silver bands with their hooks of silver and their sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits, and the width fifty throughout, and the height five cubits of fine twisted linen, and their sockets of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the utensils of the tabernacle used in all its service, and all its pegs, and all the pegs of the court, shall be of bronze.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall charge the sons of Israel, that they bring you clear oil of beaten olives for the light, to make a lamp burn continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tent of meeting, outside the veil which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall keep it in order from evening to morning before the Lord; it shall be a perpetual statute throughout their generations for the sons of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then bring near to yourself Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, from among the sons of Israel, to minister as priest to Me—Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to all the skillful persons whom I have endowed with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron’s garments to consecrate him, that he may minister as priest to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These are the garments which they shall make: a breastpiece and an ephod and a robe and a tunic of checkered work, a turban and a sash, and they shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons, that he may minister as priest to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall take the gold and the blue and the purple and the scarlet material and the fine linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “They shall also make the ephod of gold, of blue and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen, the work of the skillful workman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall have two shoulder pieces joined to its two ends, that it may be joined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The skillfully woven band, which is on it, shall be like its workmanship, of the same material: of gold, of blue and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: six of their names on the one stone and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, according to their birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a jeweler engraves a signet, you shall engrave the two stones according to the names of the sons of Israel; you shall set them in filigree settings of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, as stones of memorial for the sons of Israel, and Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord on his two shoulders for a memorial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make filigree settings of gold,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and two chains of pure gold; you shall make them of twisted cordage work, and you shall put the corded chains on the filigree settings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make a breastpiece of judgment, the work of a skillful workman; like the work of the ephod you shall make it: of gold, of blue and purple and scarlet material and fine twisted linen you shall make it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be square and folded double, a span in length and a span in width.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall mount on it four rows of stones; the first row shall be a row of ruby, topaz and emerald;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the second row a turquoise, a sapphire and a diamond;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the third row a jacinth, an agate and an amethyst;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the fourth row a beryl and an onyx and a jasper; they shall be set in gold filigree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stones shall be according to the names of the sons of Israel: twelve, according to their names; they shall be like the engravings of a seal, each according to his name for the twelve tribes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make on the breastpiece chains of twisted cordage work in pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make on the breastpiece two rings of gold, and shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the two cords of gold on the two rings at the ends of the breastpiece.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put the other two ends of the two cords on the two filigree settings, and put them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, at the front of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two rings of gold and shall place them on the two ends of the breastpiece, on the edge of it, which is toward the inner side of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two rings of gold and put them on the bottom of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, on the front of it close to the place where it is joined, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall bind the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so that it will be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastpiece will not come loose from the ephod.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall carry the names of the sons of Israel in the breastpiece of judgment over his heart when he enters the holy place, for a memorial before the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put in the breastpiece of judgment the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be over Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the Lord; and Aaron shall carry the judgment of the sons of Israel over his heart before the Lord continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There shall be an opening at its top in the middle of it; around its opening there shall be a binding of woven work, like the opening of a coat of mail, so that it will not be torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make on its hem pomegranates of blue and purple and scarlet material, all around on its hem, and bells of gold between them all around:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, all around on the hem of the robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be on Aaron when he ministers; and its tinkling shall be heard when he enters and leaves the holy place before the Lord, so that he will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a plate of pure gold and shall engrave on it, like the engravings of a seal, ‘Holy to the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall fasten it on a blue cord, and it shall be on the turban; it shall be at the front of the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, and Aaron shall take away the iniquity of the holy things which the sons of Israel consecrate, with regard to all their holy gifts; and it shall always be on his forehead, that they may be accepted before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall weave the tunic of checkered work of fine linen, and shall make a turban of fine linen, and you shall make a sash, the work of a weaver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For Aaron’s sons you shall make tunics; you shall also make sashes for them, and you shall make caps for them, for glory and for beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them on Aaron your brother and on his sons with him; and you shall anoint them and ordain them and consecrate them, that they may serve Me as priests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make for them linen breeches to cover their bare flesh; they shall reach from the loins even to the thighs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall be on Aaron and on his sons when they enter the tent of meeting, or when they approach the altar to minister in the holy place, so that they do not incur guilt and die. It shall be a statute forever to him and to his descendants after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what you shall do to them to consecrate them to minister as priests to Me: take one young bull and two rams without blemish,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and unleavened bread and unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil; you shall make them of fine wheat flour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put them in one basket, and present them in the basket along with the bull and the two rams.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the doorway of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the garments, and put on Aaron the tunic and the robe of the ephod and the ephod and the breastpiece, and gird him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall set the turban on his head and put the holy crown on the turban.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall bring his sons and put tunics on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall gird them with sashes, Aaron and his sons, and bind caps on them, and they shall have the priesthood by a perpetual statute. So you shall ordain Aaron and his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall bring the bull before the tent of meeting, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall slaughter the bull before the Lord at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take some of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; and you shall pour out all the blood at the base of the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take all the fat that covers the entrails and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them, and offer them up in smoke on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the flesh of the bull and its hide and its refuse, you shall burn with fire outside the camp; it is a sin offering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also take the one ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall slaughter the ram and shall take its blood and sprinkle it around on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall cut the ram into its pieces, and wash its entrails and its legs, and put them with its pieces and its head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall offer up in smoke the whole ram on the altar; it is a burnt offering to the Lord: it is a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall slaughter the ram, and take some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear and on the lobes of his sons’ right ears and on the thumbs of their right hands and on the big toes of their right feet, and sprinkle the rest of the blood around on the altar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron and on his garments and on his sons and on his sons’ garments with him; so he and his garments shall be consecrated, as well as his sons and his sons’ garments with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also take the fat from the ram and the fat tail, and the fat that covers the entrails and the lobe of the liver, and the two kidneys and the fat that is on them and the right thigh (for it is a ram of ordination),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and one cake of bread and one cake of bread mixed with oil and one wafer from the basket of unleavened bread which is set before the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you shall put all these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and shall wave them as a wave offering before the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take them from their hands, and offer them up in smoke on the altar on the burnt offering for a soothing aroma before the Lord; it is an offering by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then you shall take the breast of Aaron’s ram of ordination, and wave it as a wave offering before the Lord; and it shall be your portion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall consecrate the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the heave offering which was waved and which was offered from the ram of ordination, from the one which was for Aaron and from the one which was for his sons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion forever from the sons of Israel, for it is a heave offering; and it shall be a heave offering from the sons of Israel from the sacrifices of their peace offerings, even their heave offering to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, that in them they may be anointed and ordained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days the one of his sons who is priest in his stead shall put them on when he enters the tent of meeting to minister in the holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket, at the doorway of the tent of meeting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they shall eat those things by which atonement was made at their ordination and consecration; but a layman shall not eat them, because they are holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If any of the flesh of ordination or any of the bread remains until morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire; it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus you shall do to Aaron and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded you; you shall ordain them through seven days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each day you shall offer a bull as a sin offering for atonement, and you shall purify the altar when you make atonement for it, and you shall anoint it to consecrate it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and consecrate it; then the altar shall be most holy, and whatever touches the altar shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two one year old lambs each day, continuously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one lamb you shall offer in the morning and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and there shall be one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of beaten oil, and one-fourth of a hin of wine for a drink offering with one lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, and shall offer with it the same grain offering and the same drink offering as in the morning, for a soothing aroma, an offering by fire to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the doorway of the tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet with you, to speak to you there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will meet there with the sons of Israel, and it shall be consecrated by My glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will consecrate the tent of meeting and the altar; I will also consecrate Aaron and his sons to minister as priests to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will dwell among the sons of Israel and will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall know that I am the Lord their God who brought them out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them; I am the Lord their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Moreover, you shall make an altar as a place for burning incense; you shall make it of acacia wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its length shall be a cubit, and its width a cubit, it shall be square, and its height shall be two cubits; its horns shall be of one piece with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top and its sides all around, and its horns; and you shall make a gold molding all around for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make two gold rings for it under its molding; you shall make them on its two side walls—on opposite sides—and they shall be holders for poles with which to carry it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall put this altar in front of the veil that is near the ark of the testimony, in front of the mercy seat that is over the ark of the testimony, where I will meet with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall burn fragrant incense on it; he shall burn it every morning when he trims the lamps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Aaron trims the lamps at twilight, he shall burn incense. There shall be perpetual incense before the Lord throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall not offer any strange incense on this altar, or burnt offering or meal offering; and you shall not pour out a drink offering on it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year; he shall make atonement on it with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once a year throughout your generations. It is most holy to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord also spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When you take a census of the sons of Israel to number them, then each one of them shall give a ransom for himself to the Lord, when you number them, so that there will be no plague among them when you number them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what everyone who is numbered shall give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs), half a shekel as a contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who is numbered, from twenty years old and over, shall give the contribution to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rich shall not pay more and the poor shall not pay less than the half shekel, when you give the contribution to the Lord to make atonement for yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall take the atonement money from the sons of Israel and shall give it for the service of the tent of meeting, that it may be a memorial for the sons of Israel before the Lord, to make atonement for yourselves.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You shall also make a laver of bronze, with its base of bronze, for washing; and you shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet from it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they enter the tent of meeting, they shall wash with water, so that they will not die; or when they approach the altar to minister, by offering up in smoke a fire sacrifice to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, so that they will not die; and it shall be a perpetual statute for them, for Aaron and his descendants throughout their generations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Take also for yourself the finest of spices: of flowing myrrh five hundred shekels, and of fragrant cinnamon half as much, two hundred and fifty, and of fragrant cane two hundred and fifty,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and of cassia five hundred, according to the shekel of the sanctuary, and of olive oil a hin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall make of these a holy anointing oil, a perfume mixture, the work of a perfumer; it shall be a holy anointing oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With it you shall anoint the tent of meeting and the ark of the testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the table and all its utensils, and the lampstand and its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the laver and its stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall also consecrate them, that they may be most holy; whatever touches them shall be holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and consecrate them, that they may minister as priests to Me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘This shall be a holy anointing oil to Me throughout your generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall not be poured on anyone’s body, nor shall you make any like it in the same proportions; it is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever shall mix any like it or whoever puts any of it on a layman shall be cut off from his people.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord said to Moses, “Take for yourself spices, stacte and onycha and galbanum, spices with pure frankincense; there shall be an equal part of each.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With it you shall make incense, a perfume, the work of a perfumer, salted, pure, and holy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall beat some of it very fine, and put part of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting where I will meet with you; it shall be most holy to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The incense which you shall make, you shall not make in the same proportions for yourselves; it shall be holy to you for the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whoever shall make any like it, to use as perfume, shall be cut off from his people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See, I have called by name Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have filled him with the Spirit of God in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all kinds of craftsmanship,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to make artistic designs for work in gold, in silver, and in bronze,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and in the cutting of stones for settings, and in the carving of wood, that he may work in all kinds of craftsmanship.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, I Myself have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the hearts of all who are skillful I have put skill, that they may make all that I have commanded you:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the tent of meeting, and the ark of testimony, and the mercy seat upon it, and all the furniture of the tent,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the table also and its utensils, and the pure gold lampstand with all its utensils, and the altar of incense,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the altar of burnt offering also with all its utensils, and the laver and its stand,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the woven garments as well, and the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, with which to carry on their priesthood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the anointing oil also, and the fragrant incense for the holy place, they are to make them according to all that I have commanded you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But as for you, speak to the sons of Israel, saying, ‘You shall surely observe My sabbaths; for this is a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, that you may know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore you are to observe the sabbath, for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work on it, that person shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there is a sabbath of complete rest, holy to the Lord; whoever does any work on the sabbath day shall surely be put to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sons of Israel shall observe the sabbath, to celebrate the sabbath throughout their generations as a perpetual covenant.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is a sign between Me and the sons of Israel forever; for in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, but on the seventh day He ceased from labor, and was refreshed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When He had finished speaking with him upon Mount Sinai, He gave Moses the two tablets of the testimony, tablets of stone, written by the finger of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people assembled about Aaron and said to him, “Come, make us a god who will go before us; as for this Moses, the man who brought us up from the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Aaron said to them, “Tear off the gold rings which are in the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the people tore off the gold rings which were in their ears and brought them to Aaron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took this from their hand, and fashioned it with a graving tool and made it into a molten calf; and they said, “This is your god, O Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made a proclamation and said, “Tomorrow shall be a feast to the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the next day they rose early and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, “Go down at once, for your people, whom you brought up from the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have quickly turned aside from the way which I commanded them. They have made for themselves a molten calf, and have worshiped it and have sacrificed to it and said, ‘This is your god, O Israel, who brought you up from the land of Egypt!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and behold, they are an obstinate people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now then let Me alone, that My anger may burn against them and that I may destroy them; and I will make of you a great nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Moses entreated the Lord his God, and said, “O Lord, why does Your anger burn against Your people whom You have brought out from the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why should the Egyptians speak, saying, ‘With evil intent He brought them out to kill them in the mountains and to destroy them from the face of the earth’? Turn from Your burning anger and change Your mind about doing harm to Your people.
